Which of the statement(s) is/are correct?
A wire of length 100cm and cross-sectional area 2.0 × 10-3cm2 has a resistance of 0.10 ω. Calculate its electrical conductivity.
explanation:
Electrical conductivity = the reciprocal of resistivity
but resistivity(ρ) = \(\frac{R\times A}{L}\)
resistivity(ρ)  = \(\frac{ 2.0 \times 10^{-3} \times0.1}{100}\) = 0.000002
electrical conductivity(σ) = \(\frac{1}{ρ}\)
σ  = \(\frac{1}{0.000002} = 500000ω^{-1}cm^{-1}\)

text: \(^{226}_{88}Ra\) \(\to\) \(^{222}_{86}Rn\) + X + Energy. The equation above represents a nuclear decay of radium isotope. What is X?
explanation:
Mass Number:The mass number on the left side is 226 (from Ra) and 222 (from Rn) on the right side. Let A be the mass number of  X:
226 = 222 + A ⇒ A = 226 - 222 = 4
Atomic Number:The atomic number on the left side is 88 (for Ra) and 86 (for Rn) on the right side. Let Z be the atomic number of X:
88 = 86 + Z ⇒ 88 - 86 = 2
Therefore, X is an alpha particle.

text: A body that produces its own light is said to be
Two equal capacitances are connected first in series and then in parallel. The ratio of the effective series capacitance to the effective parallel capacitance is
explanation:
Assume the two equal capacitors are 2 micro-farads respectively( you can assume any number)
Effective capacitor in series = \(\frac{1}{C_1} + \frac{1}{C_2}\)
=  \(\frac{1}{2} + \frac{1}{2}\) = \(\frac{2}{2}\) = 1 micro-farads
Effective capacitance in parallel = \(C_1 + C_2\) =  2 + 2 = 4 micro-farads
The ratio of the effective series capacitance to the effective parallel capacitance  = 1: 4 = \(\frac{1}{4}\) = 0.25

text: The resistance of a series R-C circuit is 5 ω If the impedance of the circuit is 13 ω calculate the reactance of the capacitor
The motion of the prongs of a sounding turning fork is
A constant force of 5N acts for 5s on a mass of 5kg initially at rest. Calculate the final momentum of the mass.
explanation:
According to Newton's second law of motion, \(force =  \frac{ final momentum - initial momentum}{time}\)
but momentum = mass x velocity; F= 5N, Initial mass = 5kg, time = 5secs, initial velocity = zero
then final momentum = force x time (since initial momentum of the mass = 0, that is  5 x 0)
= 5 x 5 = 25 kgms-1

text: A stone is released from a height of 80m above the ground. Calculate its velocity just before it strikes the ground. (g = 10ms\(^{-2}\))
explanation:
Velocity before reaching the ground ( v ) = \(\sqrt{2gH}\) from the third equation of motion.
v = \(\sqrt{2 \times 10 \times 80}\) = \(\sqrt{1600}\) = 40m/s

text: Which of the following motions will be produced by a pair of equal, opposite and non-collinear parallel forces acting on a body?
explanation: A couple consists of two equal and opposite forces acting at a separation, so that net force becomes zero. When a couple acts on a body it rotates the body but does not produce any translational motion. Hence, only rotational motion is produced.

text: The inability of the eye to focus near objects is known as
explanation: Hypermatropia ( long-sightedness) is the inability of the eye to focus near objects.

text: A transformer is required to give 120V from a 240V mains supply. If the primary has 5500 turns, how many turns has the secondary?
The distance between two successive crests of a water wave is 0.5m. If a particle on the surface of the water wave makes two complete vertical oscillations in 1s, calculate the speed of the wave.
In 90 seconds, the mass of a radioactive element reduces to \(\frac{1}{16}\) of its original value. Determine the half- life of the element.
explanation:
\(\frac{1}{16} = (\frac{1}{2})^n\)
\((\frac{1}{2})^4 = (\frac{1}{2})^n\)
\(n = 4\)
90 secs = 4 half lives
1 half life = \(\frac{90}{4}\) secs
= 22.5 secs
